Archon.name: Archon
Archon.description: Created by merging two templar units, the archon is a powerful melee unit with a very durable force shield and a strong energy-based attack.

Carrier.name: Carrier
Carrier.description: A powerful air unit. Carriers do not have their own attacks but create interceptors to fight for them.

Colossus.name: Colossus
Colossus.description: The large quad-legged vehicle fires lasers in a splash pattern well-suited to destroying swarms of weaker units. This unit can also traverse differences in terrain height due to its long legs, and will appear to step over ledges and other obstacles due to the inverse kinematics system.

High Templar.name: High Templar
High Templar.description: A physically fragile unit with strong psychic abilities.

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Dragoon-like walker with a strong defense against powerful attacks, but vulnerable to weaker attacks.

Mothership.name: Mothership
Mothership.description: A powerful flying unit that consumes a high amount of resources to produce. It has powerful special abilities.

Observer.name: Observer
Observer.description: A cloaking air unit that functions as a detector.

Phoenix.name: Phoenix
Phoenix.description: An aerial fighter with an anti-gravity ability that lifts ground units into the air.

Probe.name: Probe
Probe.description: The builder of the protoss race. Gathers gas and minerals.

Sentry.name: Sentry
Sentry.description: Formerly known as the disruptor,[1] and the nullifier before that.[2] A ground support unit.

Stalker.name: Stalker
Stalker.description: A dragoon-like Nerazim unit, able to blink (short-range teleport) and deliver ranged attacks against air and ground units.

Void Ray.name: Void Ray
Void Ray.description: Formerly known as the warp ray,[3] this flying unit deals damage with a blue energy beam that does more damage as it focuses on the same target. Good against heavily armored targets like buildings, weak against small arms fire.

Warp Prism.name: Warp Prism
Warp Prism.description: Formerly known as the phase prism,[4] the warp prism is a dual-purpose unit, able to transport units or to create a warp matrix field like the pylon.

Zealot.name: Zealot
Zealot.description: Melee unit with the ability to charge, allowing it to quickly close the distance between itself and an enemy unit.

Assimilator.name: Assimilator
Assimilator.description: Allows probes to harvest vespene gas from geysers.

Cybernetics Core.name: Cybernetics Core
Cybernetics Core.description: Allows for the warping in of stalkers and sentries. Also allows research of weapon and armor upgrades for air units.

Dark Shrine.name: Dark Shrine
Dark Shrine.description: Formerly known as the dark obelisk,[5] it allows dark templar to be warped in.

Fleet Beacon.name: Fleet Beacon
Fleet Beacon.description: Allows the carrier and the mothership to be warped in.

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.description: Allows the construction of photon cannons and research of Protoss ground unit upgrades.

Gateway.name: Gateway
Gateway.description: Warps in the zealot, the stalker, the sentry, the high templar, and the dark templar.

Nexus.name: Nexus
Nexus.description: Produces probes and is the place that all minerals and gas are dropped off at to be processed. Also produces the mothership.

Photon Cannon.name: Photon Cannon
Photon Cannon.description: A defensive structure with a ranged attack effective against ground and air units.

Pylon.name: Pylon
Pylon.description: The protoss supply building; it produces a radius of energy that is a requisite for the placement of most other protoss structures.

Robotics Bay.name: Robotics Bay
Robotics Bay.description: Formerly known as the null circuit,[6][7] this structure enables a robotics facility to produce colossi and contains upgrades for observers and warp prisms.

Robotics Facility.name: Robotics Facility
Robotics Facility.description: Warps in the warp prism, observer, colossus, and immortal.

Stargate.name: Stargate
Stargate.description: Warps in the phoenix, void ray and carrier.

Templar Archives.name: Templar Archives
Templar Archives.description: Allows the high templar unit to be warped in.

Twilight Council.name: Twilight Council
Twilight Council.description: Contains upgrades for stalkers and zealots.

Warp Gate.name: Warp Gate
Warp Gate.description: The gateway has the ability to transform into a warp gate, which can warp-in units at any spot within the psionic matrix.

Mothership Core.name: Mothership Core
Mothership Core.description: A base defense unit that can overcharge structures, recall allies and slow enemies. Can be upgraded into the mothership.

Oracle.name: Oracle
Oracle.description: A light, psionic, support and harassment ship. Can grant vision and harass light units and workers with its pulsar beam.

Tempest.name: Tempest
Tempest.description: A long-range capital ship that excels at taking down massive units.

Adept.name: Adept
Adept.description: Ground-only ranged attack unit, armed with psionic transfer ability to teleport to nearby locations for harassment.

Disruptor.name: Disruptor
Disruptor.description: Light ground mechanized support unit, armed with energy spikes to wreak havoc against swaths of ground forces.

Shield Battery.name: Shield Battery
Shield Battery.description: Recharges the shields of protoss units and defensive structures.

Stasis Ward.name: Stasis Ward
Stasis Ward.description: Cloaked structure created by the Oracle. Used to freeze incoming units.

Auto-Turret.name: Auto-Turret
Auto-Turret.description: An automated defensive combat structure produced by the Raven.

Banshee.name: Banshee
Banshee.description: A cloak-capable gunship able to only attack ground-based targets.

Battlecruiser.name: Battlecruiser
Battlecruiser.description: The capital ship of the terran fleet, this powerful spacecraft is capable of firing a Yamato Cannon that deals large damage to a single target.

Ghost.name: Ghost
Ghost.description: Stealth specialist with access to several powerful and different abilities than in StarCraft I.

Hellion.name: Hellion
Hellion.description: Formerly known as the jackal, this fast vehicle is armed with a flamethrower[8][9] suited for destroying masses of weaker units.

Marauder.name: Marauder
Marauder.description: The replacement for the firebat.[10] Its attack slows enemy units and deals high damage against armored units.

Marine.name: Marine
Marine.description: The basic terran infantry, able to upgrade hit points with a shield.

Medivac.name: Medivac
Medivac.description: A dual-purpose unit combining the old dropship and the medic, it is capable of transporting ground units and healing infantry.

MULE.name: MULE
MULE.description: A temporary unit summoned by an orbital command that harvests minerals for a limited time span.

Point Defense Drone.name: Point Defense Drone
Point Defense Drone.description: A device which intercepts incoming shots produced by the Raven.

Raven.name: Raven
Raven.description: Formerly known as the nighthawk, vulkan[11] and nomad, this air detector creates smaller independent munitions.[12]

Reaper.name: Reaper
Reaper.description: Exceptionally fast infantry that uses dual pistols, can jet pack up and down ledges and uses explosives against buildings.

SCV.name: SCV
SCV.description: The builder and resource gatherer of the terran race. Its Repair ability can be set to "autocast".

Siege Tank.name: Siege Tank
Siege Tank.description: Terran tank that can transform into a stationary 'siege cannon' mode, allowing it to strike targets at a greater range.

Thor.name: Thor
Thor.description: This intimidating mechanical unit is named after the Norse god of thunder. Can deal splash damage to air units and fire powerful cannons at ground targets.

Viking.name: Viking
Viking.description: This terran vehicle can transform between a walking robot and a spacecraft.

Command Center.name: Command Center
Command Center.description: Produces SCVs and serves as a drop off point for processing of minerals and gas. Has the ability to carry up to five SCVs and can upgrade to the powerfully armed planetary fortress or the ability oriented orbital command.

Fusion Core.name: Fusion Core
Fusion Core.description: Formerly known as the anti-matter core[13] and the deep space relay, this structure allows production of battlecruisers and provides researches for them.

Ghost Academy.name: Ghost Academy
Ghost Academy.description: This structure enables ghosts to be produced and provides researches for them. In addition, it stores nuclear missiles for launch.

Missile turret.name: Missile turret
Missile turret.description: Anti-air turret that fires two missiles at a time.

Orbital Command.name: Orbital Command
Orbital Command.description: This upgrade to the command center provides scanner sweeps to reveal troop movements through the fog of war and detect cloaked or burrowed units, summons MULEs, and can increase the supply generated by supply depots.

Planetary Fortress.name: Planetary Fortress
Planetary Fortress.description: This immobile upgrade of the command center grants it weapons to attack enemy ground units and a large boost to armor.

Refinery.name: Refinery
Refinery.description: Refines vespene gas for collection by SCVs.

Sensor Tower.name: Sensor Tower
Sensor Tower.description: Can sense enemy units through the fog of war.

Supply Depot.name: Supply Depot
Supply Depot.description: Provides supply required for additional terran units and can submerge, enabling troops to walk over it. It is smaller than in StarCraft I and can be made into an important part of terran base defenses, preventing enemy units from walking past them. This ability is called Lower/Raise.

Reactor.name: Reactor
Reactor.description: Doubles the number of units produced from the building to which it is attached (for instance, adding one to a barracks will enable it to create two marines at the same time).

Tech Lab.name: Tech Lab
Tech Lab.description: Enables the production of "higher tech" units. For instance, adding a tech lab to a barracks will allow it to produce marauders, while adding one to a factory will enable it to build siege tanks. Upgrades marine combat shields and specific upgrades and special abilities for the hellion, siege tank, viking, banshee, medivac dropship, and raven.

Hellbat.name: Hellbat
Hellbat.description: Transformable variant unit from the hellion, better equipped for close combat.

Widow Mine.name: Widow Mine
Widow Mine.description: Mobile defensive unit, buries and launches missiles at foes.

Cyclone.name: Cyclone
Cyclone.description: Mobile assault unit, armed with twin Typhoon missile pods that engage air and ground threats.

Liberator.name: Liberator
Liberator.description: Transformable medium-sized gunship, armed with anti-ground cannons after transforming into a stationary air platform.

Baneling.name: Baneling
Baneling.description: This green rolling unit is mutated from the zergling. It has a huge suicidal attack. A huge swarm of banelings will create devastating results to an enemy's base.

Brood lord.name: Brood lord
Brood lord.description: High hit point aerial ground attacker which replaced the swarm guardian, evolving from the corruptor.

Broodling.name: Broodling
Broodling.description: Produced from destroyed buildings and brood lord attacks.

Changeling.name: Changeling
Changeling.description: A spy created by the overseer that morphs into enemy units.

Corruptor.name: Corruptor
Corruptor.description: Attacks and "corrupts" other air units, increasing damage taken.

Drone.name: Drone
Drone.description: Harvests resources and spawns structures. Is sacrificed when creating new structures.

Hydralisk.name: Hydralisk
Hydralisk.description: Basic ranged attacker of the zerg swarm.

Infested terran.name: Infested terran
Infested terran.description: Spawned by the infestor, hardier versions of the normal terran marine but with a limited lifespan.

Infestor.name: Infestor
Infestor.description: Zerg spellcaster. Provides ground support and can move while burrowed.

Larva.name: Larva
Larva.description: The core genus of the zerg, larvae can mutate into other zerg breeds.

Mutalisk.name: Mutalisk
Mutalisk.description: The basic air offensive unit of the zerg with high movement speed.

Overlord.name: Overlord
Overlord.description: Produces control and is no longer a detector like the StarCraft I version.

Overseer.name: Overseer
Overseer.description: A spellcaster evolution of the overlord. Works as a detector and has numerous special abilities.

Queen.name: Queen
Queen.description: The new queen is very different than its StarCraft I counterpart, being a powerful attacking ground dwelling support unit ideal for zerg defense.

Roach.name: Roach
Roach.description: Exceptionally tough short ranged unit able to quickly regenerate and move while burrowed.

Ultralisk.name: Ultralisk
Ultralisk.description: Massive zerg melee attacker able to deal splash damage with its melee attack. Also has a headbut attack against buildings. Other differences from its StarCraft I counterpart are it now having four kaiser blades instead of two, and its ability to burrow.

Zergling.name: Zergling
Zergling.description: Fast but weak melee attacker ideal for swarming attacks in large numbers.

Baneling Nest.name: Baneling Nest
Baneling Nest.description: Required for baneling production and researches baneling upgrades.

Creep Tumor.name: Creep Tumor
Creep Tumor.description: This burrowed structure resembling an eyeball extends the creep, much like the creep colony in StarCraft I. Creep tumors are spawned by queens and each can spawn one additional creep tumor.

Evolution Chamber.name: Evolution Chamber
Evolution Chamber.description: Provides basic upgrades for the zerg ground units.

Extractor.name: Extractor
Extractor.description: Allows drones to extract vespene gas.

Greater Spire.name: Greater Spire
Greater Spire.description: Upgrade of the spire, enables production of brood lords.

Hatchery.name: Hatchery
Hatchery.description: Spawns larvae to be morphed into other zerg strains, generates creep and digests minerals and gas into a usable form. The queen is spawned directly from the hatchery.

Hive.name: Hive
Hive.description: Upgrade of the lair giving access to the most advanced buildings.

Hydralisk Den.name: Hydralisk Den
Hydralisk Den.description: Required for the production of hydralisks and researches hydralisk upgrades.

Infestation Pit.name: Infestation Pit
Infestation Pit.description: Enables creation of infestors and researches infestor upgrades.

Lair.name: Lair
Lair.description: Upgrade of the hatchery giving access to more advanced buildings and providing upgrades for overlords and overseers.

Nydus Network.name: Nydus Network
Nydus Network.description: Enables creation of nydus worms and acts as an entrance to the nydus transport system.

Nydus Worm.name: Nydus Worm
Nydus Worm.description: The new transport structure for the zerg, similar to the nydus canal of StarCraft I. Produced from the nydus network. Unlike nydus canals which could only be placed on creep, nydus worms may be spawned anywhere within sight range.

Roach Warren.name: Roach Warren
Roach Warren.description: Enables production of roaches and researches roach upgrades.

Spawning Pool.name: Spawning Pool
Spawning Pool.description: Required for production of zerglings and queens and researches zergling upgrades.

Spine Crawler.name: Spine Crawler
Spine Crawler.description: A mobile creep-bound defensive structure that attacks ground units.

Spire.name: Spire
Spire.description: Required to produce mutalisks and corruptors and provides upgrades for aerial units.

Spore Crawler.name: Spore Crawler
Spore Crawler.description: A mobile creep-bound anti-air defensive structure.

Ultralisk Cavern.name: Ultralisk Cavern
Ultralisk Cavern.description: Required to produce ultralisks and researches ultralisk upgrades.

Swarm Host.name: Swarm Host
Swarm Host.description: Siege unit, spawns timed locusts to send at targets.

Viper.name: Viper
Viper.description: Aerial support unit, able to blind groups of ranged units and abduct enemy units to its position.

Lurker.name: Lurker
Lurker.description: A long ranged siege unit that evolves from the hydralisk. Must burrow to attack, but does damage in a line.

Ravager.name: Ravager
Ravager.description: An artillery unit that evolves from the roach. Can use corrosive bile to destroy force fields and hit clumps of units at range.

Lurker Den.name: Lurker Den
Lurker Den.description: Enables hydralisks to morph into lurkers. Contains upgrades for lurkers.
